research: We are committed to participatory research and design methods that involve partners in every stage of a project, including data collection, analysis and results. We disseminate our research findings through academic journals, books, public and scholarly presentations, reports, and public presentations.
summary2: We work with partners to co-design processes for collective storytelling, collaborative learning, and impactful civic engagement as a means of creating a more equitable and purposeful civic life.

tagline.html: Our Students and faculty apply their creative skills and passions, alongside our partners, to transform narratives for local social justice.

summary1.html:
The Engagement Lab was founded in 2010 as part of the Visual and Media Arts department at Emerson College to explore how creativity and the arts could reshape the institutions governing public life. Through the speculative lens of new and emerging technology, we asked: Who could participate in public life? How should they participate? And what are the political costs of non-participation?

For more than ten years, the Engagement Lab’s faculty, students, and staff have worked with communities and organizations all over the world to explore the role of games, virtual reality, data visualization, artificial intelligence, and storytelling of all sorts, in achieving a more just society. We embrace collaborative design methods in all that we do, and highlight the power of working with those closest to problems to imagine and realize desirable outcomes.

Today, we offer a masters degree in “Media Design” and an undergraduate minor in “Social Impact Design,” and have focused our curriculum on Emerson’s local communities of Boston and Los Angeles. We organize and facilitate classes across the College’s disciplines and work with dozens of partners to create truly dynamic classroom experiences for our students and partners alike.
